item.title: Beth add a quote by H.G. Wells
item.description: "The forceps of our minds are clumsy forceps, and crush the truth a little in taking hold of it." -- H.G. Wells

item.title: Beth add a quote by Youngblood Hawke
item.description: "When I grow old I want to regret the things I've done, not the things I haven't done." -- Youngblood Hawke

item.title: Beth add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Not knowing when the dawn will come I open every door." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Beth add a quote by Henry Wadsworth Longfellow
item.description: "Every man has his secret sorrows which the world knows not; and often times we call a man cold when he is only sad." -- Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

item.title: Beth add a quote by C. JoyBell C.
item.description: "We can't be afraid of change. You may feel very secure in the pond that you are in, but if you never venture out of it, you will never know that there is such a thing as an ocean, a sea. Holding onto something that is good for you now, may be the very reason why you don't have something better." -- C. JoyBell C.

item.title: Beth add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "The heart is a very, very resilient little muscle. It really is." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Beth add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Give sorrow words; the grief that does not speak knits up the o-er wrought heart and bids it break." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Beth add a quote by Bei Dao
item.description: "In the world I am Always a stranger I do not understand its language It does not understand my silence" -- Bei Dao

item.title: Beth add a quote by Deborah Reber
item.description: "Letting go doesn't mean that you don't care about someone anymore. It's just realizing that the only person you really have control over is yourself." -- Deborah Reber

item.title: Beth add a quote by Tony Robbins
item.description: "If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten. " -- Tony Robbins
